groups.name: namastack.outbox.instance
groups.description: Outbox instance management and coordination configuration

properties.name: namastack.outbox.enabled
properties.description: Whether the outbox functionality is enabled. Set to false to disable outbox auto-configuration entirely.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.poll-interval
properties.description: Interval in milliseconds at which the outbox is polled

properties.name: namastack.outbox.batch-size
properties.description: Maximum number of record keys to process in a single batch

properties.name: namastack.outbox.rebalance-interval
properties.description: Interval in milliseconds at which partition rebalancing is triggered

properties.name: namastack.outbox.polling.batch-size
properties.description: Maximum number of records to process in a single batch

properties.name: namastack.outbox.polling.trigger
properties.description: The polling trigger strategy to use. Options: 'fixed', 'adaptive'

properties.name: namastack.outbox.polling.fixed.interval
properties.description: Fixed interval in milliseconds between polling cycles

properties.name: namastack.outbox.polling.adaptive.min-interval
properties.description: Minimum interval in milliseconds between polling cycles for adaptive polling

properties.name: namastack.outbox.polling.adaptive.max-interval
properties.description: Maximum interval in milliseconds between polling cycles for adaptive polling

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.max-retries
properties.description: Maximum number of retry attempts for failed outbox records

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.policy
properties.description: Retry policy strategy. Options: 'fixed', 'linear', 'exponential'

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.fixed.delay
properties.description: Fixed delay in milliseconds between retry attempts for fixed delay retry policy

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.linear.initial-delay
properties.description: Initial delay in milliseconds for linear backoff retry policy

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.linear.increment
properties.description: Amount in milliseconds to add for each subsequent retry

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.linear.max-delay
properties.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds for linear backoff retry policy

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.exponential.initial-delay
properties.description: Initial delay in milliseconds for exponential backoff retry policy

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.exponential.max-delay
properties.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds for exponential backoff retry policy

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.exponential.multiplier
properties.description: Multiplier for exponential backoff. Each retry delay is multiplied by this factor.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.jitter
properties.description: Maximum jitter in milliseconds to add or subtract from each delay. A random value between -jitter and +jitter is applied. Default: 0 (no jitter).

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.include-exceptions
properties.description: Fully qualified class names of exceptions that should trigger retries. Only exceptions matching these types (including subclasses) will be retried. Example: [java.io.IOException, java.net.SocketTimeoutException]

properties.name: namastack.outbox.retry.exclude-exceptions
properties.description: Fully qualified class names of exceptions that should NOT trigger retries. All exceptions except these types (and their subclasses) will be retried. Example: [java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, javax.validation.ValidationException]

properties.name: namastack.outbox.processing.stop-on-first-failure
properties.description: Whether to stop processing remaining records for a record key when one record fails. If true (default), processing stops on first failure to maintain strict ordering. If false, continues processing other records allowing failed records to be retried later.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.processing.publish-after-save
properties.description: Whether to publish records to listeners after saving them to the outbox. If true (default), records are published to listeners and saved to outbox for durability. If false, records are only saved to outbox and not published immediately.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.processing.delete-completed-records
properties.description: If true, completed outbox records will be deleted from the outbox table after successful processing instead of being marked as completed. Default: false.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.processing.executor-core-pool-size
properties.description: Core pool size for the ThreadPoolTaskExecutor used for parallel processing of record keys. Default: 4.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.processing.executor-max-pool-size
properties.description: Maximum pool size for the ThreadPoolTaskExecutor used for parallel processing of record keys. Default: 8.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.processing.executor-concurrency-limit
properties.description: Concurrency limit for the SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor used for parallel processing of record keys when virtual threads are enabled. Default: -1 (no limit).

properties.name: namastack.outbox.instance.graceful-shutdown-timeout-seconds
properties.description: Timeout in seconds for graceful shutdown of outbox processing instances

properties.name: namastack.outbox.instance.stale-instance-timeout-seconds
properties.description: Timeout in seconds to consider an instance stale and remove it from active instances

properties.name: namastack.outbox.instance.heartbeat-interval-seconds
properties.description: Interval in seconds between instance heartbeats to indicate the instance is still active

properties.name: namastack.outbox.instance.rebalance-interval
properties.description: Interval in milliseconds at which partition rebalancing is performed

properties.name: namastack.outbox.multicaster.enabled
properties.description: Enable or disable the custom application event multicaster for @OutboxEvent handling. If true, the OutboxEventMulticaster bean is registered.

properties.name: namastack.outbox.multicaster.publish-after-save
properties.description: Whether to publish events to Spring listeners after saving them to the outbox. If true (default), events are published to listeners and saved to outbox for durability. If false, events are only saved to outbox and not published immediately.
